intro: Rhynchospora cymosa, commonly known as the clustered spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, cylindrical leaves and dense clusters of small, reddish-brown flowers. Native to wetlands and marshy areas in the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, acidic soils. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into three-lobed, dark褐色 seeds. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense stands in its natural habitat.
